newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgium makes new arrest in Cools murder case.
newsitem.headline: Belgium makes new arrest in Cools murder case.

text.p: Police made a new arrest on Monday in the investigation into the 1991 murder of Belgian socialist politician Andre Cools, Belga news agency said.
Belga said the Liege judiciary had accused 35-year old Jachino Contrino of having shadowed Cools before the assasination and of having reconnoitred the area of the killing.
Police officials were not immediately available for comment.

Six people, including former government minister Alain Van der Biest and his one-time private secretary Richard Taxquet, have been arrested in Belgium in the past two months in connection with the Cools killing.
Van der Biest denies any involvement in the killing.
Earlier this month Tunisian police arrested two Tunisian hitmen suspected of having gunned down Cools.
Belga said the two Tunisians had given information about Contrino to the Tunesian judiciary, which had passed it on to the Liege judiciary.
